data.text: What's happening this week at the UN? #MandelaDay, High-level Political Forum on #GlobalGoals & more. List of events here: https://t.co/pizWOsuDh4 https://t.co/YfKqGnLrOe

#YouNeedToKnow the #GlobalGoals, adopted by 193 countries at the UN to end poverty, protect the planet & reduce inequality. Here are daily actions you can take to transform the 🌍: https://t.co/plam9uaLaa https://t.co/4wmFc2WSY1

Climate change is real & it's happening now. But taking urgent climate action will create jobs, improve our health & save money.

Here's what you can do: https://t.co/K0aDMQXinD #GlobalGoals https://t.co/CIoV3X2dxl

“'Trickle-down' economics has proved a spectacular oxymoron. 'Torrent-up' economics far better describes the realities of wealth distribution”
- @UNHumanRights’ @GilmourUN at #HLPF2018 on need to achieve #GlobalGoals

https://t.co/Ss4uMcXdcV https://t.co/H4x7IhxYcf
Interested in ocean affairs & law of the sea? Apply to the Nippon Foundation of Japan Fellowship Programme. Info: https://t.co/TPDFEsUyTY https://t.co/uUu8ZhrDbc
On Sunday's World Youth Skills Day, see how @ILO is tackling youth unemployment & training young people to be entrepreneurs: https://t.co/uuz59fANeA #WYSD2018 https://t.co/clor0WcRXy
UN Peacekeepers from Niger work to protect civilians & support local communities. We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z  #ServingForPeace https://t.co/MNhpx0Tdxi
Investing today in youth skills means investing in the present & future of our societies. Learn more about Sunday's Youth Skills Day: https://t.co/5pConOpSRC https://t.co/L8exG0hmuY
Cities can be planned & managed in a way that is sustainable & helps achieve the #GlobalGoals: https://t.co/DLIFx2LymA https://t.co/LOaTfZKE47

Youth unemployment has hit alarming levels worldwide. Tackling the skills gap can help achieve decent jobs for young people everywhere. More on Sunday's Youth Skills Day: https://t.co/dw4lp1U0EQ #WYSD2018 https://t.co/jupzGP5wYN

Nothing could have prepared me for the bone-chilling accounts I heard in Bangladesh from Rohingya refugees who had fled widespread killings & violence in Myanmar.
-- @antonioguterres calls for action to help Rohingya refugees, in @washingtonpost.

https://t.co/1SHVHvOLDb
The #PreventGenocide Convention was adopted 70 years ago. 45 countries have yet to join. See if your country is one of them: https://t.co/7AHmLrCYhj https://t.co/crVOgUk6iI

Ahead of #MandelaDay, new exhibit on display at UNHQ in NYC celebrates the centenary of the human rights icon's birth by showcasing his contributions to the work of the UN https://t.co/u2k7UjM7dt https://t.co/sjkTUdAKLO
Meet brave men & women from Jordan who are #ServingForPeace in @UNPeacekeeping missions around the 🌎 in our latest @Instagram story ➡️ https://t.co/UH4OQC7zhU https://t.co/qsRCsYPHUq

"Migration is a positive global phenomenon. Many aging developed countries need migrants to fill crucial gaps in labour markets."

--@antonioguterres on the 1st-ever Global Compact #ForMigration, aiming to ensure safe, orderly & regular migration: https://t.co/lwlKJc7J6D https://t.co/v8CMuXog3y

“We did not have another choice than fleeing and leaving everything behind us. To me it was like a bad dream."

Millions in Mali are battling the relentless impact of insecurity, conflict and drought. Here's how you can help  ⬇️

https://t.co/ytdoFA9xIM

One UN - many different languages here on @Twitter -- now also in Hindi! 
Follow the UN in:

Arabic @UNarabic
French @ONU_fr
Hindi @UNinHindi
Kiswahili @UmojaWaMataifa
Portuguese @NacoesUnidas
Russian @UnitedNationsRU
Spanish @ONU_es https://t.co/JkPM9ve5BP

"Let us recall that the vast majority of the world’s refugees are hosted in developing countries that themselves face constraints. This responsibility must be shared globally" -- @antonioguterres https://t.co/4ercDhpx9P #WithRefugees https://t.co/l5Q6BQGWlt
Women UN Peacekeepers act as role models, inspiring women & girls in often male-dominated societies. More on the women #ServingForPeace here: https://t.co/oxU94edq2X https://t.co/IzM9yZESVG

There are currently some 258 million migrants in the world. The Global Compact #ForMigration is for them & about them... This agreement presents a blueprint for hope. -- @louise_arbour https://t.co/Z0V99OxNmb

NEWS: In historic step, countries at the UN finalize 1st-ever Global Compact #ForMigration, to ensure safe, orderly & regular migration for everyone's benefit: https://t.co/HSxt8D1zYj https://t.co/1XUwJNyfyt

UN Peacekeepers from the Niger leave their families behind and travel far from home to help protect the most vulnerable. We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z  #ServingForPeace https://t.co/n5DdAGUw7f

"We need to seize the potential of technology while safeguarding against risks & unintended consequences"
- @antonioguterres on launch of new High-Level Panel on #DigitalCooperation, co-chaired by @melindagates & Jack Ma 👉 https://t.co/DsivnFQBzs https://t.co/RwzxUnwbI9
At UNHQ on Friday countries wrap up negotiations on new Global Compact for safe, orderly & regular migration that benefits everyone: https://t.co/LYzXqUkghi https://t.co/74H72rktvN

"The scourge of sexual harassment affects every corner of every society – and the UN is no exception... I am determined to do all we can to tackle sexual harassment" -- @antonioguterres https://t.co/AfrCJxPrdL

We live in a male-dominated world with a male-dominated culture.  

This is 1 reason why ensuring gender parity & the empowerment of women & girls is central.

I am determined to do all we can to tackle sexual harassment. 
-@antonioguterres  
https://t.co/GcIIhKBbFf

If migration is inevitable, it needs to be better organized through effective int’l cooperation among countries of origin, transit & destination, so that we don't leave control of movements of people in the hands of smugglers - @antonioguterres Watch: https://t.co/WhwXXmCYWf https://t.co/yvQNtFeC9y

“Climate change is inextricably linked to some of the most pressing security challenges of our time” -- @AminaJMohammed at UN Security Council.

https://t.co/CiL2KZLTVG
Meet military & police officers from Zambia #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping around the 🌎 in our latest @instagram story ➡️ https://t.co/UH4OQBPYqm https://t.co/LJESuBNui0

$30 trillion. That is the global cost of not educating girls.
Find out more in @MalalaFund-@WorldBank study launched on Thursday, UN Messenger of Peace @Malala's 21st birthday: https://t.co/oQylhHDSA5

“The Rohingya people cannot become forgotten victims. We must answer their clear appeals for help with action.” -- @antonioguterres in new piece after visiting Rohingya refugees in Bangladesh.

https://t.co/F6cSM2tsD6

Climate change hits the most vulnerable the hardest. Watch to see how @WFP's projects support vulnerable communities & help them build long-term resilience. Get involved here: https://t.co/nMjW6lBXHf https://t.co/ULIbrYmeGh

Ginger is incorrectly believed to have contraceptive properties. On #WorldPopulationDay, see other ineffective & even harmful methods of family planning: https://t.co/DgCNG6Kdah https://t.co/iXVumrhAvR

This #WorldCup, millions of refugees around the 🌍 are dreaming of one goal: to live a life with dignity. Here's how you can stand #WithRefugees who lost everything: https://t.co/caA7IaKILG https://t.co/R2c0weFAaC

Access to safe family planning is a human right & essential for achieving the #GlobalGoals. @UNFPA is offering couples in remote areas access to contraception. https://t.co/fXvHrDIezC #WPD2018 https://t.co/B9URkDPhfU
Cities occupy just 3% of 🌎 land, but account for 75% of carbon emissions. Learn how #GlobalGoals aim to create sustainable cities: https://t.co/J1MlvmUolH https://t.co/p7too2exvV

50 years ago, family planning was declared a human right. Yet, 59M people still use traditional methods that are unreliable & may be unsafe. See some examples on Wednesday's #WorldPopulationDay: https://t.co/hWtNXMW6Uh https://t.co/xFNPAnZtDE

are top 10 innovators, says Global Innovation Index 2018: https://t.co/SWKSYDPvOC https://t.co/8ahgrcVvhG
South Sudan: @UNHumanRights report documents gross violations against civilians, particularly women & children, that may amount to war crimes ➡ https://t.co/EOW3z5L8rg https://t.co/tEq63zWQmh

"My Planet, My Future: Space for Sustainability."

New exhibit at UNHQ in NYC uses satellite images & videos to show progress contribution of space science to the #GlobalGoals. More: https://t.co/2qnhYLtUnd https://t.co/IYJzSkh4Yu

"Today, let us commit to build on Nelson Mandela’s example of selflessness, tolerance & sense of shared purpose." -Deputy Secretary-General @AminaJMohammed on #Mandela100
https://t.co/Cv25hvyzTr https://t.co/bonorFI9QL

UN peacekeepers from the Jordan travel far from home to help protect the most vulnerable. We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z  #ServingForPeace https://t.co/IFm5oLWsoG
9 out of 10 people worldwide breathe polluted air and 7 million people die every year from air pollution. Children, women & outdoor workers are most affected. https://t.co/WPgOWhlno5

This yr Nelson Mandela would have turned 100. On 2 Dec @AminaJMohammed will join @glblctzn in Johannesburg, where Mandela became a global activist, to support the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/HDXuNDJXvs https://t.co/U6Bor8WmSH

We live in an era of technological miracles. 

Yet 2.4B people lack access to basic sanitation services. 

The #GlobaGoals aim to ensure that everyone has sustainably managed water & sanitation by 2030. https://t.co/LmU0GezZWG
https://t.co/EdrXJtEgkW

.@UNHumanRights expert @YangheeLeeSKKU says Myanmar’s failure to dismantle discriminatory laws against the Rohingya or make northern Rakhine State safe makes it impossible for refugees to return home in near future: https://t.co/r2W7ShQg8t https://t.co/GYoQnoV88K

Every 2 minutes, a child drowns. A new exhibit on display in NYC calls attention to the need for safety for people living near water. Info on drowning prevention here: https://t.co/byDCjfRBg8 https://t.co/AMEdjUUemn
This week at UNHQ in New York: countries identify gaps &  lessons learned to help achieve #GlobalGoals. Info here ➡️ https://t.co/clp7uWMpKl https://t.co/3XrURxIsvH
Continues this week @UNGeneva: UN Human Rights Committee. Info & documents here: https://t.co/BHkQ9L7LF2 #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/5BtF5rj2Cq
Continues this week @UNGeneva: Committee on the Elimination of Discrimination against Women, 70th session [2-20 July]. https://t.co/kmX99PP349 https://t.co/ge2Sx3gt4Q

What's happening this week at the UN? High-level Political Forum on #GlobalGoals,World Population Day, World Youth Skills Day & more. List of events here: https://t.co/pizWOsuDh4 https://t.co/6UAkuqcapH

This week at UNHQ countries wrap up negotiations on a new Global Compact for  safe, orderly & regular migration that benefits everyone. Find out more here: https://t.co/LYzXqU2FpK https://t.co/ZgyHhDTGXm

UN Peacekeepers leave their families behind and travel to some of the most hostile environments on the 🌍 to help others. More on the brave men & women #ServingForPeace ➡️ https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z https://t.co/vJxaOG20g8
Interested in working at the UN? The Young Professionals Programme is now open for applications. Deadline: 9 August. More from @UN_Careers: https://t.co/yBgBGT8Sqf https://t.co/tcZyDlkT2u

"There’s a strength and clarity, and especially moral clarity, that was very moving and uplifting for me". 
-- @WorldBank President @JimYongKim on meeting with Rohingya refugees in Bangladesh. https://t.co/RGVhWrvqR7

I urge the Security Council to immediately refer Myanmar to the @IntlCrimCourt so that all allegations of crimes against humanity & genocide perpetrated against the Rohingya can be investigated - @UNhumanrights chief Zeid https://t.co/LfNLmcqQGa

This week in Bangladesh @AntonioGuterres & @JimYongKim heard directly from Rohingya refugees who have fled unspeakable atrocities in Myanmar & appealed to the int'l community for support. https://t.co/LoFqVN31fG

In Guatemala, @UN_Women is supporting a government-run shelter where victims of the Volcán de Fuego eruption have sought refuge.

The levels of sexual violence, of rape as a weapon of war in this crisis are appalling. We need to do more to help these people.

--@AntonioGuterres on his meeting with Rohingya refugee women👇 Watch his full @Facebook live from Bangladesh: https://t.co/mhsETPA2Lb https://t.co/eHTwdBt70g

Low quality healthcare is increasing the burden of illness & health costs globally. @WHO explains what quality means & reiterates its call for #HealthForAll https://t.co/3kCj1fq4H3 https://t.co/90KRR3NpBa

⚠️ @ITU says every person generates 6+ kgs of eWaste every year.

Together with @UNICEF & the rest of the UN family, @UNMigration stands with migrant and refugee children.

 https://t.co/RdVHY4yhvj
Syria: more updates from @RefugeesChief & others about the conflict's continued devastating impact on civilians are here: https://t.co/Td4MwJVvTg https://t.co/1HafxV85pL

It's the largest humanitarian crisis in the 🌎
22M+ people in Yemen need humanitarian aid ⚠️
Here is how the @UNOCHA & partners are helping: https://t.co/cXWlej0aSN

Due to crossfire in South West Syria:
- 750,000 lives are in danger
- 320,000 people are displaced 

@RefugeesChief calls on all parties to redouble efforts to cease hostilities &  allow delivery of life-saving assistance: 

https://t.co/dqHOS1ZwX4

#FightRacism -- @UNHumanRights expert notes how some countries are illegally using citizenship, nationality & immigration laws to justify racist policies https://t.co/lvbJLuUKG6 #StandUp4HumanRights  https://t.co/bm7H9JUKtX

5 keys to protect yourself & your loved ones when preparing food: 
🔹 Keep clean
🔹 Separate raw & cooked
🔹 Cook thoroghly
🔹 Keep food at safe temperatures
🔹 Use safe water

More from @who here: https://t.co/Mlv98KhNWv https://t.co/bxJFSD2aHZ
Men aren’t allowed in @UNFPA's women-friendly spaces in Cox’s Bazar. See how these spaces empower Rohingya refugees: https://t.co/fgkX3rLc73 via @UNFPABangladesh #WithRefugees https://t.co/IyBnE8Ty8b

Video update from @UNFPASouthSudan: Goodwill Ambassador @AshleyJudd visited a women & girls'-friendly space at a UN camp for persons displaced by conflict. Updates are here: https://t.co/PF1wsVMCD6 https://t.co/D8bZWduXEZ

"I urge much stronger efforts to hold the perpetrators of violations responsible. The perpetrators of conflict-related sexual violence must also be held to account." – @UNHumanRights Chief on Democratic Republic of the Congo. https://t.co/2SM4gRrc1H
“You must not be tired. You must have hope. We must find ways to close the gap between the tragedy today & your dream of tomorrow.” @AminaJMohammed to women of South Sudan https://t.co/HQJaUuklAt

In his own words: @AntonioGuterres describes his visit to Cox's Bazar; calls plight of Rohingya refugees one of the most tragic accounts of systematic human rights violations ever recorded.

The UN is helping: https://t.co/JGAo2INqmV https://t.co/czfA0QC73C
Sustainable development isn't possible if any part of the 🌍 population is excluded. The #GlobalGoals aim to reduce inequalities: https://t.co/fRqpuj1y4G https://t.co/EOoTdPNGzv
What kind of aid do the people of DPR Korea need? Top humanitarian official explains the work of the UN in this new interview: https://t.co/FMl5eFz4C0
“For the children, we will not give up on peace” – a promise from Deputy Secretary-General @AminaJMohammed to displaced women across #SouthSudan. Video from @unmissmedia. https://t.co/Rr8IdoE2QA

“Peace is the only way forward” -- @UnicefChief update on Yemen, where:

11 million children need assistance
8.4 million are on the brink of famine
A child dies every 10 minutes

“We must save our beautiful blue planet, our home, from destruction. We, the kids, are the future.”

Here are some tips for job interviews at the UN: 
1. Prepare stories about your accomplishments.
2. Be ready to discuss your ability to learn from experience.
3. Listen to questions carefully.
